intro: Primulina jiuwanshanica, commonly known as the Jiuwanshan primrose, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat destruction, it faces threats to its survival in the wild.
